description: Fundamental course in organic chemistry based upon the modern concepts of structure and mechanism of reactions.
name: ORGANIC CHEMISTRY I

values.comments:
The Principles of Organic Chemistry is a fundamental course in organic chemistry, based upon the modern concepts of structure and mechanism of reactions.  It is a requirement for the chemistry major.  Students must previously have taken Chem 102 to enroll.

Students thought Bode was a good lecturer and skilled at explaining the complex material, but several complained that he was inaccessible after hours.  He did not answer email and also did not hold office hours.  One student commented that Bode “is very passionate about the material, and would be great if he were around more often.”

Several students also complained about the pop-quizzes that were given sporadically in class.  Many felt that they would have been more compelled to do the reading if the quizzes were weekly or scheduled, and felt that the surprise format added unnecessary stress.

Students were not fond of the textbook, describing it as “horrible” and “impossible to understand.”  One student advised that the supplemental book, Organic Chemistry as a second language, “was very helpful in learning and grasping the material.”
